snippet: Known for her vocal runs on the Rolling Stones’ “Gimme Shelter,” Ms. Clayton will receive an award from the Jazz Foundation of America at the Apollo, where Mr. Richards will perform.
abstract: Backup singer Merry Clayton will receive Clark & Gwen Terry Award for Courage at Jazz Foundation of America benefit at Apollo Theater; soulful vocalist, heard on Rolling Stones’s song Gimme Shelter, suffered career setback after June 2014 car crash necessitated amputation of both her legs; Rolling Stones’s member Keith Richards will note Clayton’s honor with live performance at gala.
lead_paragraph: Known for her vocal runs on the Rolling Stones’ “Gimme Shelter,” Ms. Clayton will receive an award from the Jazz Foundation of America at the Apollo, where Mr. Richards will perform.

headline.print_headline: Keith Richards Honors an Injured Session Singer
headline.main: Keith Richards Honors Merry Clayton After Car Crash
